intro: Thesium australe, commonly known as the Australian thesium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and slender, branched stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in spikes, typically blooming in spring. Thesium australe is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing features such as succulent leaves that help conserve water. It is often found in sandy soils and is considered a low-growing perennial herb.
